trends.id: finnish quantum unicorn iqm set to go public
trends.title: Finnish quantum unicorn IQM set to go public
trends.summary: Finnish unicorn IQM plans to go public via a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) valuing the company at approximately $1.8 billion — joining the growing cohort of quantum computing companies listed on U.S. stock markets.

trends.id: nvidia brings aipowered cybersecurity to worlds critical infrastructure
trends.title: NVIDIA Brings AI-Powered Cybersecurity to World’s Critical Infrastructure
trends.summary: As technologies and systems become more digitalized and connected across the world, operational technology (OT) environments and industrial control systems (ICS) — from energy and manufacturing to transportation and utilities — are increasingly depending on enterprise networks and the cloud. This expands OT and ICS capabilities — but also their exposure to cyber threats. Unlike Read Article

trends.id: vpn flaws allowed chinese hackers to compromise dozens of ivanti customers says report
trends.title: VPN flaws allowed Chinese hackers to compromise dozens of Ivanti customers, says report
trends.summary: Chinese hackers allegedly broke into the network of an Ivanti subsidiary in 2021. The hackers exploited a backdoor in its VPN product, which allowed the hackers to gain access to 119 other unnamed organizations.

trends.summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has summoned Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei to the Pentagon for a tense discussion over the military's use of Claude. Hegseth has threatened to designate Anthropic a "supply chain risk."

trends.id: say goodbye to the undersea cable that made the global internet possible
trends.title: Say Goodbye to the Undersea Cable That Made the Global Internet Possible
trends.summary: History was unmade last year, as engineers began the massive project of ripping the first-ever transoceanic fiber-optic cable from the ocean floor. Just don’t mention sharks.

trends.id: nasa delays launch of artemis ii lunar mission once again
trends.title: NASA Delays Launch of Artemis II Lunar Mission Once Again
trends.summary: A failure in the helium flow of the SLS rocket has prompted NASA to delay the Artemis II moon mission. Rather than March 6, the launch is now targeted for April.

trends.title: Bill Gurley says that right now, the worst thing you can do for your career is play it safe
trends.summary: "The number one thing is to get out of your head this ideal that gets passed around in the self-help world: 'go get a mentor,' and everyone runs out and cold calls someone that's ridiculously too high and unachievable, and it doesn't work."

trends.id: quantonations doublesized second fund shows quantum still has believers
trends.title: Quantonation’s double-sized second fund shows quantum still has believers
trends.summary: Quantonation Ventures, a venture firm investing in quantum and physics-based startups, has closed its oversubscribed second fund at €220 million, or approximately $260 million. That’s more than twice the size of its inaugural fund, and comes in addition to other signals that the quantum winter isn’t coming yet.
